de.ralleytn.simple.input

Class MouseControl

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.ralleytn.simple.input.MouseControl

  • public final class MouseControl
extends java.lang.Object
    Responsible for controlling the mouse with a gamepad.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Version:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Ralph Niemitz/RalleYTN(ralph.niemitz@gmx.de)

    • Method Detail

      • setEnabled

        public void setEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Enables or disables the mouse control. Default is false.
        Parameters:
        enabled - true = enabled, false = disabled
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • setAnalogStick

        public void setAnalogStick(int analogStick)
        Sets which analog stick will be used to control the mouse cursor. Default is GamepadEvent.ANALOG_STICK_LEFT.
        Parameters:
        analogStick - the analog stick
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • setSensity

        public void setSensity(float sensity)
        Sets the cursor sensity. The cursor moves faster with higher sensity. Cursor control can be inverted by setting a negative value. If the sensity is 0.0F, the cursor will not move. Default is 5.0F.
        Parameters:
        sensity - the sensity
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • mapLeftMouseButtonTo

        public void mapLeftMouseButtonTo(int gamepadButton)
        Maps the left mouse button to a button on the gamepad. Default is GamepadEvent.BUTTON_X.
        Parameters:
        gamepadButton - the gamepad button
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • mapRightMouseButtonTo

        public void mapRightMouseButtonTo(int gamepadButton)
        Maps the right mouse button to a button on the gamepad. Default is GamepadEvent.BUTTON_A.
        Parameters:
        gamepadButton - the gamepad button
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • mapMiddleMouseButtonTo

        public void mapMiddleMouseButtonTo(int gamepadButton)
        Maps the middle mouse button to a button on the gamepad. Default is GamepadEvent.BUTTON_NONE.
        Parameters:
        gamepadButton - the gamepad button
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • isEnabled

        public boolean isEnabled()
        Returns:
        true if the mouse control is enabled, else false
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • getAnalogStick

        public int getAnalogStick()
        Returns:
        the analog stick with which the mouse is controlled
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • getSensity

        public float getSensity()
        Returns:
        the cursor sensity
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • getLeftMouseButtonMapping

        public int getLeftMouseButtonMapping()
        Returns:
        the gamepad button that is mapped to the left mouse button
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • getRightMouseButtonMapping

        public int getRightMouseButtonMapping()
        Returns:
        the gamepad button that is mapped to the right mouse button
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • getMiddleMouseButtonMapping

        public int getMiddleMouseButtonMapping()
        Returns:
        the gamepad button that is mapped to the middle mouse button
        Since:
        1.0.0
